channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Now it’s like, ‘OK, you’re in office. I’m still getting done dirty at the grocery store”: Hispanic voters’ inflation fatigue weighs on Trump polling
item.description: The October survey from AP-NORC finds that 25% of Hispanic adults have a “somewhat” or “very” favorable view of Trump.

item.title: Stanford athlete turned wealth guru had everything he wanted by 30, but was miserable: ‘I had the high-paying job, the title, the house, the car’
item.description: “The 5 Types of Wealth” author Sahil Bloom had all the trappings of success—but he quickly realized that money doesn't buy happiness.

item.title: Inflation Data Could Push Stocks to Record Highs
item.description: The S&P 500 has touched all-time highs following three of the past five CPI reports.

item.title: There Are 3 Types of Leaders, Says Jay Shetty, and Only 1 You Want to Be
item.description: The hit podcaster, who has interviewed Bill Gates, Ray Dalio, and Selena Gomez, shares what he’s learned about leadership.

item.title: AI ‘Consulting’ Services Can Help Smaller Businesses, but Risks Persist
item.description: As with anything related to AI-generated content, it’s important to keep a human in the loop before you act on any of its business advice.

item.title: There Are Lots of Ways to Raise Capital. Here’s How 3 Inc. 5000 Founders Did It
item.description: The founders of Bogg Bag, Culina Health, and Kona Ice spoke about growth capital at this week’s Inc. 5000 conference.

item.title: The heiress of $10 billion Perdue Farms and the $12 billion Sheraton Hotels empire wore hand-me-downs, still rides the subway, and flies economy
item.description: “If you’re always going on private jets, what inkling do you have about the real world?”

item.title: Inflation is still ‘the dog that didn’t bark’ as delayed CPI report shows cooler-than-expected rise to 3%
item.description: Chris Zaccarelli of Northlight Asset Management told Fortune that inflation reminds him of "a Sherlock Holmes’ story."
